pull.title: wallet: Add a deprecation warning for newly created legacy wallets
pull.body: As we slowly deprecate legacy wallets, we need to warn users that are making new legacy wallets that their wallet type is going to be unsupported in the future.

events.body: Concept NACK on removal. Users shouldn't be forced to upgrade their wallets (especially not on such a short timeline).

Concept ACK

@luke-jr this just adds the warning when a wallet is created, nothing is removed nor an upgrade is enforced. When do you think the warning is okay?
The warning text says it will be removed. And if the user has to explicitly choose to create it, I don't see why a warning is really needed at all.
Concept ACK on discouraging creating new legacy wallets. Agree that the code to support them shouldn't be removed any time soon, but that kind of policy discussion is out of scope here.

Wouldn't it be better to update the RPC doc instead? This way the user will see the warning before creating the wallet.

```
            {"descriptors", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, RPCArg::Default{true}, "Create a native descriptor wallet. The wallet will use descriptors internally to handle address creation"},
I agree with @MarcoFalke that the RPC help would need to be updated, either first or at the same time, per the principle of least surprise to the user.
Added a warning to the RPC help.

events.message: wallet: Add a deprecation warning for newly created legacy wallets

events.body:
ACK 61152183ab18960c8b42cf22ff7168762946678e

Tested the help and the test with logging the result

```
 test/functional/wallet_createwallet.py
...
2022-03-10T13:00:33.383000Z TestFramework (INFO): Test legacy wallet deprecation
2022-03-10T13:00:33.485000Z TestFramework (INFO): {'name': 'legacy_w0', 'warning': 'Wallet created successfully. The legacy wallet type is being deprecated and support for creating and opening legacy wallets will be removed in the future.'}
```
```
 ./src/bitcoin-cli help createwallet

6. descriptors             (boolean, optional, default=true) Create a native descriptor wallet. The wallet will use descriptors internally to handle address creation. Setting to "false" will create a legacy wallet; however, the legacy wallet type is being deprecated and support for creating and opening legacy wallets will be removed in the future.
```

ACK 61152183ab18960c8b42cf22ff7168762946678e

```
$ ./src/bitcoin-cli -regtest -named createwallet wallet_name=wallet_native descriptors=false
{
  "name": "wallet_native",
  "warning": "Wallet created successfully. The legacy wallet type is being deprecated and support for creating and opening legacy wallets will be removed in the future."
}
$ ./src/bitcoin-cli -regtest -named createwallet wallet_name=wallet_desc descriptors=true
{
  "name": "wallet_desc",
  "warning": ""
}
$ ./src/bitcoin-cli -regtest help createwallet | grep "6. descriptors"
6. descriptors             (boolean, optional, default=true) Create a native descriptor wallet. The wallet will use descriptors internally to handle address creation. Setting to "false" will create a legacy wallet; however, the legacy wallet type is being deprecated and support for creating and opening legacy wallets will be removed in the future.
```

issue.title: Proposed Timeline for Legacy Wallet and BDB removal
issue.body:
Here is a proposed timeline for the move from legacy wallets to descriptor wallets, and at the same time, bdb to sqlite, culminating with the removal of both legacy wallets and bdb. Even though the wallet type and the wallet storage format are orthogonal to each other, as noted in #19077, I would like to tie them together for the sake of simplicity when it comes to how we make new wallets and the migration of one type to another.

The 4 combinations of type and format are: legacy-bdb, legacy-sqlite, descriptor-bdb, and descriptor-sqlite. While all 4 types will be supported, we will primarily deal with legacy-bdb and descriptor-sqlite. Setting `descriptors=True` in `createwallet` (or checking the Descriptors option in the GUI) will always make a descriptor-sqlite. Setting that to `False` will always make a legacy-bdb.

- [x] 0.21 (late 2020)
  - [x] Initial release of descriptor type and sqlite format. (#16528, #19077)
  - [x] Descriptor type is experimental with a warning as such (#16528)
  - [x] Only legacy-bdb and descriptor-sqlite will be created (#19077)
- [x] 22.0 (mid 2021)
  - [x] Implement descriptor exports (#20226)
  - [x] Legacy type remains default (no pr needed)
  - [x] Introduce `dump` and `createfromdump` wallet tool commands with an additional `-format` option to specify the wallet type (#19137)
    * Users may use `dump` and then `createfromdump` in order to make legacy-sqlite from legacy-bdb
    * Users may use `dump` and then `createfromdump` in order to make descriptor-bdb from descriptor-sqlite
  - [x] If a wallet specified in conf or command line doesn't exist, don't make a wallet and instead warn (#15454)
- [x] 23.0 (early 2022)
  - [x] Change descriptor type to non-experimental (#23002)
  - [x] Change `createwallet` `descriptors` default to `True` (#23002)
  - [x] Change wallet tool `create` `-descriptors` default to `True` (#23002)
- [x] 24.0 (late 2022)
  - [x] Introduce `migratewallet` command to migrate a legacy-bdb to descriptor-sqlite (#19602)
  - [x] For newly created legacy-bdb wallets, warn that they are deprecated and will soon be unsupported (#24505)
- [ ] 26.0 (late 2023)
  - [ ] Reimplement legacy-bdb to descriptor-sqlite migration (maybe as a separate command or in the wallet tool) to be independent of `LegacyScriptPubKeyMan` and BDB (#26596)
  - [ ] For `dump`, implement an independent BDB file loader (this should probably be shared with the previous) (#26606)
  - [x] When loading legacy-bdb, descriptor-bdb, or legacy-sqlite wallets, warn that the legacy type and bdb format will soon be unsupported, as applicable. (#27869)
- [ ] 27.0 (early 2024)
  - [ ] Stop creating new legacy-bdb wallets (not yet started)
  - [ ] Make the loading warning louder (not yet started)
- [ ] 28.0 (late 2024)
  - [ ] Stop loading legacy-bdb, descriptor-bdb, legacy-sqlite wallet entirely. Inform users how to migrate (not yet started)
  - [ ] Remove `LegacyScriptPubKeyMan` except for the independent migration stuff (not yet started)
  - [ ] Remove BDB except for independent loading for migration stuff (not yet started)

The migration code will probably be around for a long time/forever.

Note that we expect users who go through the effort to make a legacy-sqlite or descriptor-bdb wallet to suck it up and deal with the consequences of doing something that isn't really supported. Such users should be able to figure out for themselves how to migrate their wallets. (Maybe `migratewallet` can migrate legacy-sqlite to descriptor-sqlite. bdb to sqlite is way easier than legacy to descriptor).

comments.body:
- s/opening/creating/
- s/Legacy/legacy/
- be unambiguous that the wallet was still created

suggestion:
```suggestion
        warnings.push_back(_("Wallet successfully created, but be aware that the legacy wallet type is expected to be deprecated, and support for creating legacy wallets may be removed in the future"));
```

Added `Wallet created successfully` and lowercase `legacy.` However there is no "expected to be" or "may" about the removal of the legacy wallet. It _will_ be removed in the future, whether that's in a few years, or in fifty. Additionally, this warning is to inform users that their newly created legacy wallet will have issues with being opened in the future. It's already created, so warning that creation will be removed is useless. `opening` is the correct word to use.

             {"blank", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, RPCArg::Default{false}, "Create a blank wallet. A blank wallet has no keys or HD seed. One can be set using sethdseed."},
             {"passphrase", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "Encrypt the wallet with this passphrase."},
             {"avoid_reuse", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, RPCArg::Default{false}, "Keep track of coin reuse, and treat dirty and clean coins differently with privacy considerations in mind."},
-            {"descriptors", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, RPCArg::Default{true}, "Create a native descriptor wallet. The wallet will use descriptors internally to handle address creation"},

+                                                                       "Setting to 'false' will create a legacy wallet, however the legacy wallet type is being deprecated and"
comments.body:
missing spaces
```text
6. descriptors             (boolean, optional, default=true) Create a native descriptor wallet. The wallet will use descriptors internally to handle address creation.Setting to 'false' will create a legacy wallet, however the legacy wallet type is being deprecated andsupport for creating and opening legacy wallets will be removed in the future.
```
suggested diff with added spaces and minor grammar fixups
```suggestion
                                                                       " Setting to \"false\" will create a legacy wallet; however, the legacy wallet type is being deprecated and "
```

maybe both creating and opening like in the help (and add a period to the second sentence)
```suggestion
        warnings.push_back(_("Wallet created successfully. The legacy wallet type is being deprecated and support for creating and opening legacy wallets will be removed in the future."));
```
